intro: Astragalus xylobasis, commonly known as the woodbase milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for wildlife. Astragalus xylobasis is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
